alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 2:51AM PST until February 22 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Heavy snow in the Sierra through this evening with low snow levels... .A cold weather system will continue bring moderate to heavy snow to the northern Sierra Nevada today. This will lead to significant travel impacts across the passes. Lowering snow levels on Tuesday may bring a dusting of snow down into the lower foothill elevations. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional accumulations of 8 to 12 inches. * WHERE...West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada including Interstate 80 over Donner Pass, Highway 50 over Echo Summit and Highway 88 over Carson Pass. * WHEN...Through 10 PM today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
